Again Von Soden, like his school in general, exaggerates the negative side of the Epistle: the writer, he says, ignores the Resurrection. What does he make of the phrase τῆς δόξης 111 ii. 12 This surely involves the belief in the Resurrection and Ascension and even 111 1110 Divinity of Christ.

The final result of his investigation is that the Epistle was written at Rome during the reign of Domitian to Christians generally.
